At Jim's request, here is a short, boring story about what happened in London at the weekend for Mike and Rosie's birthday(s)..... Went to Lovell's after work on Friday. The train (Virgin, obviously) was 35 minutes late at Birmingham and proceeded to add a further half hour before even reaching Coventry. An astonishing feat of incompetence, even for them, as I'm sure you'll agree. Should have been at Basingstoke at 9, got there at just after 10. Brilliantly though, the barrel of a train manageress was so busy "dealing" with angry customers and shelling out the equivalent of Africa's combined GDP in taxi vouchers, that she forgot to make me pay. Cool. So that was £42.40 saved (£42.40!!! - wankers). Went to Ryan's house, saw Richard and Helen too and sat about smoking/joking/licking up Lovell at NBA StreetJam. Had an enjoyable morning sharing some right-wing views with Lovell's parents before heading to London for Gay-mes in Finsbury Park. Al quite reasonably pointed out that we ought not to play any "traditional English games" for fear of being arrested for stirring up racial hatred. After all, Captain Hook lives around there. Highlight of the afternoon was when the annoying "noisy throwing toy" got stuck in the tree and Smeaton immediately lost the football up there too trying to get it down. At least an hour of throwing objects at the tree ensued. There followed a game of (by now quite drunken) rounders in which there seemed to be no consistent rules but rather a steady flow of cheating from key protagonists - notably Hawkins and Lovell. I was no way out! Afterwards, back to the Manor ladies' boudoir for barbecue and binge drinking. Lovell threw a huge whitey, but handled it as only he can - by making it very funny. The usual crowd in attendance, plus a few extras such as Rhys who came back from Barcelona. Don't remember too much more about it and made a snap decision to go home immediately upon waking and somehow managed to get to Marylebone and up to Birmingham in one piece. I did however have a great time sleeping on the very crowded train, safe in the knowledge that I was chuffing out nerve gas with a 5-metre kill radius. Barbecue and booze had turned my insides rotten. Brilliant. Phrase of the weekend: "I'm going to cut off a length of bum-rope" Fully expect that to make an appearance in Forrester's links (and also at selected parties).
